title: How to Eat Nigiri Sushi

steps.headline: Do not use chopsticks.
steps.description: Nigiri sushi is not supposed to be eaten with chopsticks. It is designed to be eaten by hand. Using chopsticks is a big no-no when it comes to eating nigiri sushi. You are also supposed to eat sushi rolls with your hands as well, not chopsticks.

steps.headline: Clean your hands.
steps.description: In some sushi restaurants, you will be offered a hot towel at the beginning of the meal. Wipe your hands with the towel to clean them and then refold the towel. If you are not offered a towel at the beginning of your meal, go to the bathroom and wash your hands. In a pinch, you can also use hand sanitizer to clean your hands.

steps.headline: Use your thumb and middle finger to hold the sushi.
steps.description: Pick up the nigiri sushi with your dominant hand using your thumb and middle finger. Do not squeeze the sushi too tightly, just enough so you can hold it comfortably between your fingers.

steps.headline: Position the sushi so the fish is upward.
steps.description: Make sure the sushi is positioned so the fish is facing upward and the rice is facing downward. This will make it easier for you to eat the sushi properly.

steps.headline: Pour a small amount of soy sauce in the shoyu dish.
steps.description: At sushi restaurants, you will be given a shoyu dish for soy sauce. Do not pour a large amount of soy sauce in the dish. Instead, pour a very small amount of soy sauce, just enough to dip the piece of sushi in. Never pour the soy sauce directly on the sushi, as this ruins the flavor of the fish. In some cases, if the sushi is high quality, you do not need to have it with any soy sauce at all.

steps.headline: Flip the sushi over and dip it in the soy sauce.
steps.description: Holding the sushi between your thumb and middle finger, flip it over so the fish side is facing downward. Then, dip it lightly once in the soy sauce. Do not dunk or drown it in the sauce. A quality piece of nigiri sushi does not need a lot of soy sauce. Never put the rice side of the sushi in the soy sauce, as the rice will soak up the sauce and the flavor of the sushi will be compromised.

steps.headline: Add a small amount of wasabi to the fish before eating it.
steps.description: Nigiri sushi is made with a small dab of wasabi already placed between the fish and the rice. It has been placed there by the sushi chef based on their understanding of the fish. Only add a small amount of wasabi to the top of the fish before you eat it if you prefer a stronger wasabi taste. If you prefer a more subtle wasabi taste, you may not need to add more wasabi to the sushi.

steps.headline: Eat nigiri in one bite.
steps.description: Nigiri sushi is meant to be eaten in one bite. If the sushi is too large for you to eat in one bite, do your best. Try to eat the sushi in one to two bites at the most. Avoid cutting the sushi with your teeth or pulling it apart with your hands. This will compromise the flavor and texture of the sushi.

steps.headline: Have pickled ginger between bites to cleanse your palette.
steps.description: Most sushi restaurants provide pickled ginger that you are supposed to eat between bites of sushi. The ginger serves as a palette cleanser. Do not eat the ginger with the sushi, as this will compromise the flavor.
